result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan J. Castillo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: 12 month DPA - Upon successful completion State will dismiss.  Conditions:  1)  Not to commit any new criminal offenses; 2) Notify the FDL DA's Office & Clerk of Court's of any change of address/phone number within 48 hours; 3) Comply with all terms of diversion supervision, including reporting to the Diversion Coordinator on the 1st Wednesday of each month; 4) Pay diversion program supervision fees of $25/mo. to DA's Office; 5) Write a letter of apology to Officer Pfalzgraf with conditions specified in DJA within 30 days; 6) Make reasonable attempts to locate/maintain full-time employment/education and provide documentation to Diversion Coordinator; 7) Complete 40 hours of Community Service at a non-profit organization & provide documentation; 8) Not to possess and/or consume alcohol and/or controlled substances during period of this agreement; 9) Attend and successfully complete an alcohol & drug assessment iwthin 90 days of signing this agreement, as well as complete any recommended follow through counseling/treatment of the assessor prior to the end of the diversion term; sign any releases required by Diverstion Coordinator.

supervisions.notes: State law REQUIRES a DNA sample be provided for every criminal offense committed after April 1, 2015.

No Huber privileges.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
